PERSONAE.TITLE: Dramatis Personae
PERSONAE.PERSONA: CLOTEN, son to the Queen by a former husband.
POSTHUMUS LEONATUS, a gentleman, husband to Imogen.
BELARIUS, a banished lord, disguised under the name of Morgan.

PGROUP.GRPDESCR: sons to Cymbeline, disguised under the names of Polydote and Cadwal, supposed sons to Morgan.

PERSONAE.PERSONA: CAIUS LUCIUS, general of the Roman forces.
IMOGEN, daughter to Cymbeline by a former queen.
HELEN, a lady attending on Imogen.
Lords, Ladies, Roman Senators, Tribunes, a Soothsayer, a Dutchman, a Spaniard, Musicians, Officers, Captains, Soldiers, Messengers, and other Attendants.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Britain. The garden of Cymbeline's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter the QUEEN, POSTHUMUS LEONATUS, and IMOGEN
Putting a bracelet upon her arm

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. The same. A public place.
SCENE III. A room in Cymbeline's palace.
SCENE IV. Rome. Philario's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter PHILARIO, IACHIMO, a Frenchman, a
Dutchman, and a Spaniard

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Britain. A room in Cymbeline's palace.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: The QUEEN drops the box: PISANIO takes it up

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. The same. Another room in the palace.
SCENE I. Britain. Before Cymbeline's palace.
SCENE II. Imogen's bedchamber in Cymbeline's palace: a trunk in one corner of it.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: IMOGEN in bed, reading; a Lady attending
Sleeps. IACHIMO comes from the trunk

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IACHIMO
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Goes into the trunk. The scene closes

SCENE.TITLE: Scene III An ante-chamber adjoining Imogen's apartments.
SCENE IV. Rome. Philario's house.
SCENE V. Another room in Philario's house.
SCENE I. Britain. A hall in Cymbeline's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter in state, CYMBELINE, QUEEN, CLOTEN,
and Lords at one door, and at another,
CAIUS LUCIUS and Attendants

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Another room in the palace.
SCENE III. Wales: a mountainous country with a cave.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter, from the cave, BELARIUS; GUIDERIUS,
and ARVIRAGUS following

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. Country near Milford-Haven.
SCENE V. A room in Cymbeline's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter CYMBELINE, QUEEN, CLOTEN, LUCIUS,
Lords, and Attendants

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. Wales. Before the cave of Belarius.
SCENE VII. Rome. A public place.
SCENE I. Wales: near the cave of Belarius.
SCENE II. Before the cave of Belarius.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter, from the cave, BELARIUS, GUIDERIUS,
ARVIRAGUS, and IMOGEN

Re-enter ARVIRAGUS, with IMOGEN, as dead,
bearing her in his arms
Re-enter BELARIUS, with the body of CLOTEN

Enter LUCIUS, a Captain and other Officers,
and a Soothsayer

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. A room in Cymbeline's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CYMBELINE, Lords, PISANIO, and Attendants

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. Wales: before the cave of Belarius.
SCENE I. Britain. The Roman camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter POSTHUMUS, with a bloody handkerchief

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Field of battle between the British and Roman camps.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter, from one side, LUCIUS, IACHIMO, and
the Roman Army: from the other side, the
British Army; POSTHUMUS LEONATUS following,
like a poor soldier. They march over and go
out. Then enter again, in skirmish, IACHIMO
and POSTHUMUS LEONATUS he vanquisheth and disarmeth
IACHIMO, and then leaves him

The battle continues; the Britons fly; CYMBELINE is
taken: then enter, to his rescue, BELARIUS,
GUIDERIUS, and ARVIRAGUS

Re-enter POSTHUMUS LEONATUS, and seconds the
Britons: they rescue CYMBELINE, and exeunt. Then
re-enter LUCIUS, and IACHIMO, with IMOGEN

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. Another part of the field.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter POSTHUMUS LEONATUS and a British Lord
Enter two British Captains and Soldiers

Enter CYMBELINE, BELARIUS, GUIDERIUS, ARVIRAGUS,
PISANIO, Soldiers, Attendants, and Roman Captives.
The Captains present POSTHUMUS LEONATUS to
CYMBELINE, who delivers him over to a Gaoler:
then exeunt omnes

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. A British prison.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter POSTHUMUS LEONATUS and two Gaolers

Solemn music. Enter, as in an apparition,
SICILIUS LEONATUS, father to Posthumus Leonatus,
an old man, attired like a warrior; leading in
his hand an ancient matron, his wife, and mother
to Posthumus Leonatus, with music before them:
then, after other music, follow the two young
Leonati, brothers to Posthumus Leonatus, with
wounds as they died in the wars. They circle
Posthumus Leonatus round, as he lies sleeping

Jupiter descends in thunder and lightning, sitting
upon an eagle: he throws a thunderbolt. The
Apparitions fall on their knees

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Cymbeline's tent.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter CYMBELINE, BELARIUS, GUIDERIUS, ARVIRAGUS,
PISANIO, Lords, Officers, and Attendants

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CYMBELINE
SPEECH.STAGEDIR:
Enter LUCIUS, IACHIMO, the Soothsayer, and other
Roman Prisoners, guarded; POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
behind, and IMOGEN
